headline: Citi CEO’s $25 Million Bonus Is Excessive, Top Bank Analyst Mike Mayo Says
summary: The Wells Fargo analyst says the payment was awarded before shareholders have seen significant stock-price appreciation.

headline: Will Goldman Sachs' New Coverage Reinforce or Rethink CAVA (CAVA)'s Competitive Advantage Story?
summary: Goldman Sachs recently initiated coverage of CAVA Group, highlighting the restaurant brand's strong long-term growth prospects alongside current industry and economic challenges. This coverage drew attention to CAVA's position as a leading player in the expanding Mediterranean fast-casual segment, particularly as competition intensifies from rapidly franchising rivals. We'll now consider how Goldman Sachs' emphasis on CAVA's future growth outlook may influence its broader investment...

headline: Goldman Sachs CEO says tech has always impacted head count—and AI is no different: ‘Yes, job functions will change… but I’m excited about it’
summary: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said every CEO he speaks with is focused on AI automation, and despite “volatility” around jobs, humans will adjust to a new normal.

headline: Citi’s Jane Fraser consolidates power with board chair vote — and a $25 million-plus bonus to boot
summary: Citigroup’s board of directors has voted to make CEO Jane Fraser its chair of the board, giving the CEO of a major Wall Street bank a $26 million restricted stock bonus.

headline: Goldman Sachs sees upside risk to its $4,900 gold forecast
summary: Investing.com -- Goldman Sachs said it remains structurally bullish on gold despite a recent price pullback, citing continued central bank demand and growing investor interest in the metal as a strategic portfolio hedge.

raw.headline: Goldman Sachs sees upside risk to its $4,900 gold forecast

headline: Goldman Sachs Bear Call Spread Could Net 16% in Four Weeks
summary: Goldman Sachs stock has been trending lower for the last few weeks and is now below the 50-day moving average. I’m willing to bet that the stock won’t rise too much further, and today we’re going to look at a Bear Call spread trade that assumes GS won’t rise above 810 in the next four weeks..
